key_commands.description: Lists all pods in the test-social-network namespace to spot anomalies; reveals user-service pod terminating.
Describes the specific user-service pod to see detailed state and termination context.
Lists deployments and their readiness; indicates user-service has zero replicas/availability.

key_commands.command: exec_shell("kubectl describe deploy -n test-social-network user-service; kubectl get rs -n test-social-network | grep user-service; kubectl get hpa -n test-social-network")
key_commands.description: Attempts deeper diagnosis by describing the user-service deployment and checking ReplicaSets/HPAs to understand scaling behavior.
key_commands.original_command: exec_shell("kubectl describe deploy -n test-social-network user-service; kubectl get rs -n test-social-network | grep user-service; kubectl get hpa -n test-social-network")

key_commands.command: exec_shell("kubectl get deploy user-service -n test-social-network -o yaml")
key_commands.description: Fetches full deployment spec for user-service; confirms spec.replicas is 0 (root cause).
key_commands.original_command: exec_shell("kubectl get deploy user-service -n test-social-network -o yaml")

key_commands.description: Submits the localized faulty component (user-service) as the root cause due to replicas scaled to zero.
